context.p: snapshotscapturing and viewingYou can capture a snapshot of data when you monitor a pipeline.

After you capture a snapshot, you can view the snapshot data stage by stage or through a group of stages, like data preview. You can also delete snapshot data or use it as source data for data preview.

step.cmd: From the pipeline canvas of a running pipeline, click the Snapshots icon.
In the Snapshots dialog box, click Capture Snapshot to capture a set of data.
step.info: The captures a snapshot of the next batch that passes through the pipeline and displays it in the list.
step.stepresult: You can take additional snapshots, view a snapshot, delete a snapshot, or close the dialog box and use the snapshot later.

step.cmd: To view a snapshot, click View for the snapshot that you want to use.
step.stepresult: The canvas highlights the origin stage of the pipeline. The Monitor panel displays snapshot data in the Output Data column. Since this is the origin of the pipeline, no input data displays.

step.cmd: To view the snapshot for multiple stages, click Multiple.
step.info:
The Preview panel displays two lists of stages:
From the list on the left, select the first stage to include.
In the list on the right, select the last stage to include.

step.cmd: To review data from a different snapshot, on the upper left side of the monitor panel, select a different snapshot name
To exit the snapshot review, click Close Snapshot.
